history.content: I did, I studied at the University of Hong Kong.  All courses are in English.  I took equivalents to CS168 and CS170.  I also got an upper division and a lower division breadth transferred back (four out of four!).  The only annoying part was that due to the weird course unit conversions, each of the courses I took only counted for 3.3 units, not the typical 4 units.  So I ultimately wound up taking one extra EECS course.  On the upside, the courses were pretty easy compared to Berkeley.  The other major study abroad programs in HK are Chinese University of Hong Kong and Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, which are probably also good options since I believe they both also have their courses in English and I think are actually better ranked in computer science than HKU.

Some I have reviewed for students in the past: Lund, NTU, UHK, CUHK, Edinburgh, St. Andrews.

children.subject: has anyone had any luck with study abroad programs not through UCEAP? All of the UCEAP programs end pretty late in the summer which would run into summer internships.I am trying to find a program that would be outside of UCEAP but have not found luck with computer science courses

history.content: I was wondering if anyone has been lucky to find good study abroad programs for computer science and if they would be willing to share the university or programs with me! It seems like most of the programs I have looked at don't offer cs courses.
history.subject: Study Abroad: Computer Science
